trans-unit.source: Categorize devices with device group mapping | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Categorize devices with device group mapping | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use Microsoft Intune device group mapping to group devices into categories that you define, in order to make it easier for you to manage those devices.
trans-unit.target: Use Microsoft Intune device group mapping to group devices into categories that you define, in order to make it easier for you to manage those devices.

trans-unit.source: Categorize devices with device group mapping in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Categorize devices with device group mapping in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use Microsoft Intune **device group mapping** to group devices into categories that you define, in order to make it easier for you to manage those devices.
trans-unit.target: Use Microsoft Intune **device group mapping** to group devices into categories that you define, in order to make it easier for you to manage those devices.

trans-unit.source: Device group mapping uses the following workflow:
trans-unit.target: Device group mapping uses the following workflow:

trans-unit.source: You create Intune device groups for each category you want to use.
trans-unit.target: You create Intune device groups for each category you want to use.

trans-unit.source: You configure device group mapping rules that map the category you choose to the device group you created.
trans-unit.target: You configure device group mapping rules that map the category you choose to the device group you created.

trans-unit.source: When end users enroll their device, they must choose a category from the categories you configured.
trans-unit.target: When end users enroll their device, they must choose a category from the categories you configured.

trans-unit.source: After they choose, their device will be automatically added to the corresponding device group you created.
trans-unit.target: After they choose, their device will be automatically added to the corresponding device group you created.

trans-unit.source: You can then use these device groups when you deploy policies and apps.
trans-unit.target: You can then use these device groups when you deploy policies and apps.

trans-unit.source: Examples of categories might be:
trans-unit.target: Examples of categories might be:

trans-unit.source: Personal
trans-unit.target: Personal

trans-unit.source: Point of sale device
trans-unit.target: Point of sale device

trans-unit.source: Demonstration device
trans-unit.target: Demonstration device

trans-unit.source: Sales
trans-unit.target: Sales

trans-unit.source: Accounting
trans-unit.target: Accounting

trans-unit.source: Manager
trans-unit.target: Manager

trans-unit.source: However, you can configure any categories you want.
trans-unit.target: However, you can configure any categories you want.

trans-unit.source: How to configure device group mapping
trans-unit.target: How to configure device group mapping

trans-unit.source: For each device category you want to use, create an Intune device group.
trans-unit.target: For each device category you want to use, create an Intune device group.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to create groups, see [Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune](use-groups-to-manage-users-and-devices-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about how to create groups, see [Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune](use-groups-to-manage-users-and-devices-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Administration** workspace, expand **Mobile Device Management**, and then choose **Device Group Mapping**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Administration** workspace, expand **Mobile Device Management**, and then choose **Device Group Mapping**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Device Group Mapping** page, enable device group mapping.
trans-unit.target: On the **Device Group Mapping** page, enable device group mapping.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Add** to create a new mapping rule.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Add** to create a new mapping rule.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add device group mapping rule** dialog box, enter the name of the category you want to create and then, from the drop-down list, choose the device collection you want to map this category to.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add device group mapping rule** dialog box, enter the name of the category you want to create and then, from the drop-down list, choose the device collection you want to map this category to.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Add** when you are done.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Add** when you are done.

trans-unit.source: When you have finished adding categories and groups, choose **Save**.
trans-unit.target: When you have finished adding categories and groups, choose **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Now, when users enroll their device, they will be presented with a list of the categories you configured.
trans-unit.target: Now, when users enroll their device, they will be presented with a list of the categories you configured.

trans-unit.source: After they choose a category and finish enrollment, their device will be added to the device group that corresponds with the category they chose.
trans-unit.target: After they choose a category and finish enrollment, their device will be added to the device group that corresponds with the category they chose.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune
